Paragate.03/14/25 // Site Release: Today marks the release of Autononymous.io! Check out our main page for story updates.
Paragate.07/02/25 // Viewer & Story Beta:
If you're reading this right now, it's for only one of two reasons: either you're one of my trusted friends or family that I've decided to share this with, or you've randomly discovered this and you're early to the show. But either way, I want to thank you for being here and supporting my work.

 PARAGATE is the second novel I've written; one that is far more personal to me. The two main characters are manifestations of anxiety and major depression that closely resemble my own struggles with these battles, and I look forward to telling you a story about what I've learned in "fighting the good fight" against both of them.

 This is an early release of the story, so not everything is entirely nailed down yet — but it's certainly planned. That being said, if it's posted here, it's in polished enough of a form that I'm confident to post it.

 If you enjoy this work, please let me know on social media, and feel free to share it with others. I'm still figuring out this self-publishing thing (and trying to spend more of my time writing than improving this Javascript applet).

Thanks again for your support.

With love,
 Savant-Guarde :)
Paragate.07/11/25 // Prologue Update: Finished the split prologue for PARAGATE. Was pretty tough to make the damn thing read across and down most of the time, like a word puzzle or something.

Firebrand.03/14/25 // Site Release: Today marks the release of Autononymous.io! Check out our main page for story updates.
Firebrand.04/27/25 // First Act Release: Hey Readers! Since I've made extra progress with Firebrand, I decided to release the entire first act. Should get the story rolling a little better. Further updates of Acts 2 ~ 4 will continue per the standard weekly release. Thanks for your support!
Firebrand.07/02/25 // Viewer & Story Beta:
If you're reading this right now, it's for only one of two reasons: either you're one of my trusted friends or family that I've decided to share this with, or you've randomly discovered this and you're early to the show. But either way, I want to thank you for being here and supporting my work.

 FIREBRAND is the first novel I've ever written. I wrote the bulk of this during a rough time of my life, when I was going to college in a different state: starting entirely from zero and not knowing anyone; allowing loneliness and unmedicated depression to lead me into a long spiral.

 But I came out the other side and I survived, making it through the long quarters of my engineering program. The concept of a continuous fight without an end in sight provided the fuel for the thesis of this story: 'If you had an unlimited number of attempts to rewrite the past, would it break you, or would you find peace'? It also inspired the main character Titus: a suffer-it-alone kind of guy that was a lot like me before I learned my lesson, figuring out how to sincerely open up to people.

 This is an early release of the story, but the full story is entirely written: just being progressively edited. But, rest assured, if it's posted here, it's in polished enough a form that I'm confident to post it.

 If you enjoy this work, please let me know on social media and feel free to share it with others. I'm still figuring out this self-publishing thing (and trying to spend more of my time writing than improving this Javascript applet).

Thanks again for your support.

With love,
 Savant-Guarde :)

Paragate.0.1: I'm still working on formatting this prologue. Might remove it altogether.
Paragate.1.2: Chapters 'Robot Boy' through 'Surprise Approach' are in the final stage of self-revision. Everything past this is still in a generative revision.
Paragate.1.11: This chapter marks the end of chapters with extensive self-revision. The rest is in a generative state.

Firebrand.0.1: Unlike the rest of the first act, this prologue is new and still needs some work. The original draft started from Chapter Two.
Firebrand.1.2: The rest of this act is pretty well-revised and picked over.

Firebrand.Maps:
Titus gave this map to Romin after the events of the Prologue, scribbling several notes on a district map from the Ministry Of Truth. After adulteration, it must be burned — or discarded like all the other lost items they'll recover in their frostbitten trek beyond the walls.

But the real journey isn't out there. It's in the downfall of the last city of the Humans, and one cadet's desperate efforts to hold on to everything he can't save.
Firebrand.Other:
Acknowledgements

I dedicate this work to the following people:

  • Lillie, my life partner
  • Karl R, my closest friend
  • The version of me I left in the third year of college: that might have never been brave enough to fight for my mental health, and to believe in the possibility of love
  • YOU, the person giving this story a shot (and I hope you enjoy it).


Fireteam Dossiers

Recovered Documents of Royal Academy Fireteam 473

Long after the incident at Blackwater, the following files were among the documents recovered from the Royal Academy of Blackwater's Internal Affairs division. Investigation into this fireteam's firebrands is being processed by the Royal Capital to investigate the causes of the great Chosen Mask event.

Paragate.Maps:
The following maps were exchanged by Cody and Katiya.

Katiya (indefinitely) borrowed her map from the Gaffesend Headquarters — the same one she annotated after arriving to serve the Royal Guard.

Cody printed his out on the work printer when no one was looking, long after everyone left the office.
